weather.description: Current weather data for Palo Alto, CA is unavailable in this static response. Please check a live weather service for up-to-date information.
weather.recommendation: Check the current weather before departing and dress accordingly.

walkability.description: Palo Alto has good walkability, particularly in the downtown area and near California Avenue.  Residential areas are also generally walkable. However, reaching destinations outside the city center might require other transportation.
pros: Dedicated pedestrian paths in many areas
Many shops and restaurants accessible on foot
cons: Can be spread out, making longer walks less practical
Limited walkability to some industrial or outlying areas
Heavy traffic in certain areas can make crossing streets challenging

transportation_options.weather_impact: Rain or fog can significantly impact driving times due to reduced visibility and increased traffic.
pros: Fastest option in ideal traffic conditions
cons: Traffic congestion can be heavy, especially during peak hours
Parking can be expensive and difficult to find in Palo Alto
transportation_options.feasibility: Feasible, but traffic can be a major factor.

transportation_options.weather_impact: Extreme heat or rain would make this option very challenging.
Minimally affected by weather, though delays can occur.
transportation_options.feasibility: Feasible and often a good option.

transportation_options.weather_impact: Rain or strong winds can make biking more difficult.
pros: Can be faster than public transit in some cases
cons: Safety concerns sharing the road with cars
Can be challenging in hilly areas
transportation_options.feasibility: Feasible for experienced cyclists, but requires planning and awareness of bike routes.

route_summary.weather_advisory: Check a live weather service for up-to-date conditions before departing.
route_summary.feasibility_assessment: This route is feasible and commonly used.

steps.instruction: Start at your chosen location in San Francisco (e.g., Ferry Building).
Head south on Embarcadero towards I-80 East.
Merge onto I-80 East towards Oakland/Bay Bridge.
Continue onto I-880 South towards San Jose.
Take exit 1B for US-101 South towards San Jose.
Take exit 398A for University Avenue towards Palo Alto.
Arrive at your destination in Palo Alto (e.g., University Avenue).

recommendations: Check traffic conditions before you leave and consider alternate routes if necessary.
Consider using navigation apps like Google Maps or Waze for real-time updates.
Fill up your gas tank before starting the trip.
safety_concerns: Be aware of traffic congestion, especially during peak hours.
Adjust your driving speed according to weather conditions.

alternatives.description: Take Caltrain from San Francisco to Palo Alto.
